etymology.description: semantic: 氵(氵) (shuǐ, "water") + phonetic: 永(永) (yǒng) = swimming "water"
etymology.interpretation: The character 泳(泳) (yǒng, "to swim") combines the water radical 氵(氵) to emphasize its relation to water, with 永(永) (yǒng) providing the pronunciation. Swimming is inherently linked to the concept of water, making this combination intuitive.

examples.chinese: 小明喜欢游泳(小明喜歡游泳)。
夏天来临时(夏天來臨時)，大家纷纷下水游泳(大家紛紛下水游泳)。
examples.pinyin: Xiàtiān láilín shí, dàjiā fēnfēn xiàshuǐ yóuyǒng.
examples.english: When summer arrives, everyone jumps into the water to swim.

examples.chinese: 教练指导运动员游泳(教練指導運動員游泳)。
examples.english: The coach instructs the athletes in swimming.
